alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Hale; Lubbock; Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 9:29PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lubbock, Lynn, southwestern Crosby and Hale Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 929 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cotton Center to Downtown Lubbock to 4 miles west of O`Donnell. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds of 40 to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Plainview, Slaton, Abernathy, Tahoka, Hale Center, Idalou, Ransom Canyon, O`Donnell, Cotton Center, Grassland, Texas Tech University, Lubbock International Airport, Halfway, Slide, Downtown Lubbock, Woodrow, New Deal, Wilson and Buffalo Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
